newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila to review agricultural tariff cut.
newsitem.headline: Manila to review agricultural tariff cut.

text.p: Philippine Agriculture Secretary Salvador Escudero said on Thursday he would review the administrative order which provided lower tariffs for selected imported farm products.
The review announcement came two days after a Manila regional trial court issued a restraining order against the implementation of the new tariff scheme.

The scheme specifies the volume of imports of certain sensitive agricultural products that can be granted at lower tariff rates. The scheme is part of the country's commitment to the World Trade Organisation.
Escudero told reporters the review would be completed by July, but did not say whether it would lead to a revision in the administrative order.
He also declined to comment on the court decision.
The court order will affect additional imports of corn, sugar, beef, pork and chicken, an agriculture official earlier said. -- Manila Newsroom (63 2) 841-8938 Fax 817-6267
